title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent in Moreno Valley, California

content.rendered:
Once a small town, Moreno Valley is quickly growing to become one of the most dynamic cities in America. Living in Moreno Valley opens up a whole new world of shopping, entertainment and dining. This small city has a big city feel, and with everything you need at your fingertips, life in Moreno Valley is very convenient! The neighborhood is also very ethnically diverse and renowned for its food scene. If you’re looking for rooms for rent in Moreno Valley, this guide will tell you everything you need to know before you make the move — including the restaurants in Moreno Valley, its public transportation, and much more.

Related: Rooms for Rent in Pomona, CA

Where is Moreno Valley, CA?

Moreno Valley is located in the western portion of Riverside County, surrounded by Riverside, Perris, March Air Reserve Base, Lake Perris, and the Badlands. When you’re looking for rooms for rent in Moreno Valley be sure to check out the neighboring cities which all have something unique to see and do. And living in Moreno Valley means you won’t be far from many of California’s most famous destinations such as Hollywood, San Diego, and Palm Springs.

Find Rooms For Rent in Moreno Valley, CA

Find rooms for rent in Moreno Valley

Moreno Valley offers a range of quality housing options including high-end executive homes, affordable single-family homes, and condominiums. When searching for rooms for rent in Moreno Valley, you can be sure that the neighborhood is very family-friendly, with good schools and impressive amenities.

Average Rent in Moreno Valley, CA

Moreno Valley is one of the most affordable cities to live in California. This means that average rent in Moreno Valley is pretty affordable, too. However, apartment rent in Moreno Valley has increased by 23.5% in the past year.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent in Covina, CA

Is Moreno Valley Safe?

While searching for rooms for rent in Moreno Valley, you’ve probably wondered if it’s a safe area. Moreno Valley is not exactly a dangerous city, but its safety rating still needs some improvement. Crime rates here are generally above the US average, and safety depends on which neighborhood you live in. No matter where you are, it’s always important to take safety precautions to protect yourself.

  1. CrimeGrade: With this website, you can use your area’s zip code, or browse cities to check out crime rates. It’s the new standard in neighborhood-based crime data for the United States and helps you check out the safe and not-so-safe areas in your neighborhood. This is a great tool to use while looking for rooms for rent in Moreno Valley, CA.
  2. SOSecure by ADT: SoSecure lets you contact ADT, a leading provider of security services, whenever you feel unsafe. AD then proceeds to call 911 for you. You can SOS Chat, SOS Slider or Voice Activation for your emergency assistance.

Public Transit in Moreno Valley, CA

1. Walkability

With an average Walk Score of 32, you’ll most likely need a car to run errands in Moreno Valley so you can get things done quickly and easily.

2. Roads and Traffic

There are a lot of parking laws for Moreno Valley roads, so take note of them when you’re out and about. Moreno Valley is a somewhat bike-friendly neighborhood, so you can also use your bike to run errands. And to avoid traffic when you do head out, be sure to check the road conditions before you leave home.

3. Nearby Train Stations

Moreno Valley/March Field is a train station in unincorporated Riverside County, California, United States, near March Air Reserve Base and Moreno Valley. Use the Metro Links website to find trains routes, timetables, rider info and more. Nearby train stations include Towngate FS Frederick and Centerpoint FS Center Plaza.

4. Nearby Bus Stops

A great alternative to catching the train or driving, the following bus lines have routes that pass through Moreno Valley: 11, 16, 19.

Related: Is Gender Neutral Housing Right For Me?

Restaurants in Moreno Valley, CA

Woody’s Moreno Valley

Dining accompanied with music and a classy, cozy atmosphere makes for a wonderful night out, and that’s exactly what you get at Woody’s. Enjoy an extensive menu of BBQ, gourmet burgers, steaks, seafood, wine, cocktails, and beer.

Menu

Blackbear Diner Moreno Valley

Enjoy some all-American comfort food and desserts in this laidback, bear-themed eatery. They serve great breakfast, lunch, and dinner options for Moreno Valley residents and travelers passing through the neighborhood. From classic pancakes to ‘Bear’s Benedict’, you’ll love the food and the atmosphere at this kitsch diner.

Applebee’s Grill and Bar

Applebee’s Neighborhood Grill & Bar offers a casual and hearty dining experience with the very best of delicious American meals. The service here is always top-notch, and you’ll walk away with a full belly and great memories!

Parks in Moreno Valley

  1. Moreno Valley Community Park: If you want to socialize, relax, play sports, take a stroll or just watch sports games, then this park is a great place to be. It’s also a nice picnic spot for families and friends to catch up.
  2. Towngate Memorial Park: This is a great suburban park with an athletics track, softball and baseball fields, picnic tables and barbecues. And if you feel like you’re due for a workout session, you can do that here too!

Related: Find Rooms for Rent in Whittier, CA

Shopping in Moreno Valley

Moreno Valley Mall

There’s always something happening in this popular shopping mall in Moreno Valley. You’ll find a variety of stores that sell shoes, clothes, jewelry, homeware, gifts and more. There are also food courts, a multiplex cinema and a bowling alley for you to enjoy — and even a day spa day!

Towngate Shopping Center

This shopping center is home to a supermarket, retail chains, local services and casual eateries. Townsgate has everything you’re looking for and more, and they also offer great deals for shoppers. So keep your eye out for specials!

Moreno Valley Plaza

This shopping plaza contains 55 stores to serve your every need! Why not drop by here while you’re searching for rooms for rent in Moreno Valley? After all, it’s always a good idea to check out the local amenities before making the big move!

Do you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Moreno Valley, CA? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!
